resources.string: 1. In which country was COVID-19 first reported?
2. What are the most common symptoms of COVID-19?
3. How can we make our hands safe?
4. COVID-19 belongs to which family of viruses?
5. Who\'s 𝗠𝗼𝘀𝘁 at Risk From Coronavirus?
6. Can women with confirmed or suspected COVID-19 breastfeed?
Wash with soap & water for at least 20 seconds
Yes, while maintaining proper sanitation & hygiene
Ans (A) : The Coronavirus was first reported in the Wuhan district of China on December 2019.
Ans (D) : Fever, Dry cough & tiredness are all common symptoms of COVID-19. Some people may experience: aches and pains, nasal congestion, runny nose, sore throat, diarrhoea.
Ans (A) & (C) : Washing hands with soap and water is the best way to get rid of germs in most situations. If soap & water are not readily available, alcohol based sanitizers can also be used.
Ans (Coronavirus): The etiology of this illness is now attributed to a novel virus belonging to the 𝗰𝗼𝗿𝗼𝗻𝗮𝘃𝗶𝗿𝘂𝘀 (𝗖𝗼𝗩) 𝗳𝗮𝗺𝗶𝗹𝘆.

string.name: Q5_ans
string.a: Ans (A), (B) & (D) : People 65 years or older, people with asthama, people with compromised immune systems or people with livers diseases are more at risk of getting infected.

string.name: Q6_ans
string.a: Ans (B) : 𝗬𝗲𝘀. Women with confirmed or suspected COVID-19 𝗰𝗮𝗻 𝗯𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗳𝗲𝗲𝗱 if they wish to do so.
